data: The magic behind AI is math. But do not worry! We're making the AI
do most of the math for us (and this program does some of the behind
the scenes math for you). However, in order to understand how different
aspects of AI work you will need to learn at least conceptually how the math works.
If you want to delve deeper than this app into artificial intelligence, then
you will need to learn much more math than we will discuss here.
The two math concepts that really make AI run probably gave you
nightmares in high school: Calculus and Matrices. If those words
bring back trauma, there is no need to seek out your therapist. We
are not going to make you do anything more complex than multiplication.
Calculus is what enables AI to learn from its mistakes, it can
see how far its predictions were off from the real answer and perform
some calculus to see how much it needs to adjust its calculations.
This is called the loss of the model. The lower the loss, the more accurate
the AI is becoming. Loss can be calculated in a variety of different
ways depending on the needs of your model that will be discussed later on.
